A Guide to the Casinos of Tunica: Where Mississippi’s Gambling Heart Beats

Tunica, Mississippi, is renowned as the "Gambling Capital of the South," boasting a vibrant casino scene that attracts visitors from across the region. This small town on the Mississippi River has transformed itself into a thriving entertainment hub, offering a diverse range of gaming options, live entertainment, and luxurious amenities. Understanding the layout of Tunica’s casinos is crucial for any visitor looking to navigate the exciting world of gaming and entertainment.

A Geographic Overview

Tunica’s casino landscape is concentrated along a stretch of Highway 61, affectionately known as "The Casino Strip." This artery runs parallel to the Mississippi River, offering a convenient and scenic route for exploring the various casinos. The majority of the casinos are clustered within a short distance of each other, creating a dynamic and accessible gambling environment.

Tunica’s casino scene is a diverse mix of established giants and smaller, more intimate venues, each offering a unique experience. Here’s a breakdown of some of the most prominent casinos and their defining characteristics:

  • Gold Strike Casino Resort: This sprawling resort boasts a 50,000 square foot casino floor with over 1,200 slot machines, 50 table games, and a poker room. It also features luxurious accommodations, multiple dining options, and a state-of-the-art entertainment venue.
  • Fitz Casino & Hotel: Known for its lively atmosphere, Fitz Casino offers a wide variety of slots, table games, and a poker room. Its entertainment options include live music performances and comedy shows.
  • Horseshoe Tunica: This casino is renowned for its high-limit gaming options, including private gaming rooms and dedicated VIP services. It also features a luxurious spa, multiple restaurants, and a lively entertainment schedule.
  • Sam’s Town Hotel & Gambling Hall: Sam’s Town offers a relaxed and friendly environment, with a diverse selection of slots, table games, and a poker room. Its unique features include a bowling alley, a movie theater, and a variety of dining options.
  • Hollywood Casino Tunica: This casino is known for its modern and stylish design, offering a wide array of slots, table games, and a poker room. It also features a variety of dining options and a lively entertainment schedule.

  • Spa and wellness: Many casinos offer luxurious spa treatments, allowing visitors to unwind and relax.
  • Golf: Several courses are located near the casinos, providing opportunities for recreational activities.

Most casinos accept cash, credit cards, and debit cards. Some casinos may also accept prepaid cards.

Tunica offers a variety of hotels, including those located within the casinos themselves. Popular choices include Gold Strike Casino Resort, Fitz Casino & Hotel, and Horseshoe Tunica.
